content.description: This is the obvious traversing line that takes you from the lower, left most, corner to the very far right of the boulder. Keep feet off of the crumbly rock pedestal that the boulder sits on as you work your way through the power endurance moves. Don't forget to rest up before you enter the crux right at the very end! Toe hooks, heel hooks, crimps, slopers, and jugs, this climb has it all!
content.location: Start at the lower left corner of the boulder, about four feet up from an old metal rod in the base of the rock. Finish on the rounded right end of the boulder.

content.description:
The Yogurt Block boulder is a disk shaped boulder that sits on top of a rock pedestal that shoots out from the hill side. While this boulder is relatively short, at a little over 6 feet at its highest, it is very wide, about 25 or so feet long from side to side. The rock quality of the boulder is quite good although it can be crumbly in some spots (the pedestal in particular). With easy access from the road, good landing zones and its proximity to Ellicott City it'd a great boulder to throw into your rotation of Patapsco favorites! 

  While erosion currently is not a problem at this location it could easily become one. As always, please tread lightly, stay on foot paths, and leave the area looking better than it was found so other can enjoy just as you did!
